thread.title: Ireland’s Quandary: It Has a Brexit Veto That Could Be Risky to Use

author: Paul Hannon
title: Ireland’s Quandary: It Has a Brexit Veto That Could Be Risky to Use
text:
Ireland’s leaders face a serious dilemma. They are pushing hard to ensure the U.K.’s departure from the European Union doesn’t leave it with a visible land border, but they want to avoid alienating the country’s larger neighbor with which it has only lately become reconciled.

As fellow EU members, the U.K. and Ireland trade without customs checks and the two countries have an agreement to allow people to freely cross their borders. Since the 1998 Good Friday peace agreement, security checkpoints have been removed between Ireland...
